services.name: Java Online
services.description:
Learn to program in Java, one of the most important languages for commercial software development, and the language used in AP Computer Science. Many students explore our extensive curriculum and stay with our program through 12th grade.

  • Classes meet one day per week for 1.5 hours
  • Tuition is $280/month
  • Student–teacher ratio of 5:1
  • Taught by experienced programmers
  • Grades 5-12 only

    • Our weekly classes run every week throughout the year, so when you register, we will enroll you at the same class time every week (bulk enrollment). You can then cancel or reschedule individual classes online through the client portal.


    To register for weekly classes

    • Review the schedule below for a day and time slot. ( It's best to select the "Month" view. )
    • Create a client account , and add your students to the account
    • Enroll in a first class for the day and time you want, from the list of classes below.
    • To enroll in all classes of the same day and time, every week, you can:
      • Email Liz Groves at info@jointheleague.org ( Click to compose an email ) with the day and time you would like.
      • Call us at (858) 284-0481.
      • Your child's instructor can enroll your child at the beginning of class.
    For all details on enrollment, please see our Enrollment Guide and our Policies and Procedures.
services.description_short: Weekly Java classes, taught online.
services.instructions:
Canceling a Class:

  1. Sign in to the Parent Portal: https://jtl.pike13.com/accounts/sign_in
  2. Under Upcoming, click the name of the appointment you wish to cancel your registration for.
  3. Click Cancel Registration, and then choose OK.

Scheduling a Make-Up:

  1. Sign in to the Parent Portal: https://jtl.pike13.com/accounts/sign_in
  2. Select the MAKE-UP LAB tab and use the calendar to find the date of the lab you would like to sign up for.
  3. Click on it and hit the Enroll button.
  4. Select the student you would like to enroll and hit the Finish button.
Make-Up Lab Info: current lab schedule is on-line

Discord:
Questions? Comments? Want to hang out?
Join The League on Discord:
https://discord.gg/tX764zp

services.name: CSA AP Prep
services.description:
AP Computer Science A Test Prep class - In this class our students will review League curriculum as well as past College Board material, including practice questions that have been posed in previous AP exams. For Java students in Level 2 and above

Dates: Every Thursday April 3rd - May 22nd
Time: 7-8:30pm
Location: Virtual Zoom Room

  • Price: $260/month; $130/month for current League students (January and May prorated)
  • Materials: Runestone Academy online textbook (free)
  • Classes meet one day per week for 1.5 hours
  • Student–teacher ratio of 8:1
Email info@jointheleague.org with any questions.

services.name: AI Workshop
services.description:
Future Innovators AI Course: Where Kids Become Tech Creators!

Unlock Your Child’s Potential with AI! Discover the magic behind artificial intelligence in our hands-on, creative AI course. From building chatbots to generating images and exploring ethical AI, kids dive into machine learning, computer vision, and more—all guided by expert instructors. Turn curiosity into real-world skills today!

Why Our AI Course is Different

  • Hands-on learning with cutting-edge technologies
  • Experienced instructors guiding every step
  • Transform curiosity into real-world skills

What Your Child Will Discover

  • The magic behind artificial intelligence
  • How machines learn and think
  • Creative applications across art, language, and technology
services.instructions: Location: 12625 High Bluff Dr #113, San Diego, CA 92130

services.name: Intro to Java
services.description:
Is your child interested in coding? Give them the opportunity to learn one of the most widely used programming languages in the world with our Introduction to Java Camp! Our camp is designed for beginners with little or no coding experience and taught by experienced instructors who will guide your child through the basics of coding using Java. Java is a versatile programming language that is used in everything from mobile apps to enterprise software. In addition to learning valuable coding skills, your child will also have the opportunity to participate in fun activities like game design, robotics, and more. They will make new friends, learn teamwork, and develop problem-solving skills that will benefit them for years to come. Our Beginner Java Camp is the perfect way to introduce your child to the exciting world of coding and technology. Spaces are limited, so sign up today to secure your child's spot at our Beginner Java Camp. Let's get coding!


LEVEL: Beginner

Grades: 5th-12th
services.instructions:
Welcome...before your first day of class, we have some HOMEWORK for you!

  • Please have your student set up an account on GitHub. This is a TWO STEP PROCESS. First, on the GitHub site create a username and password which can be easily remembered by student. This account will be used to save class work on the first day (and each day thereafter). Second, after the account is created, GitHub will send you a verification email. You will need to open this email and follow the instructions for account verification. GitHub is a site which stores their code in the cloud so students can access it from home. It will enable students to build and organize their professional portfolio of work. Students will also be able to share their projects with you at home!

  • Email: info@jointheleague.org, and include your student’s name and their new GitHub username (you can send the password as well if you think they may forget it).

  • Upload a profile picture for your child. Their photo may be used both internally and on social media in announcements, such as when they level up. Please let us know if you do not want their photo to be used.

  1. Login to the parent portal

  2. On the right side menu under “People you manage” click on your child’s name.

  3. On their right side menu select “Photos”

  4. Click on “New Profile Photo” and upload your child’s photo

We are so excited to get started...can’t wait to see you!

services.name: Intro to Python
services.description:
Learn the basics of programming in Python with this 5-day, 10-hour course suitable for students with no prior experience, from 5th to 12th grade. Our in-person classes have 5 or fewer students per instructor, ensuring individualized attention for every student. Python is one of the most popular programming languages and is used in fields such as science, engineering, web development, artificial intelligence, and many other applications, but it is also one of the easiest languages to learn. This course teaches students the basics of programming, including variables, lists, if/then logic, and loops—skills that can be further developed in advanced classes in either Python or Java. This course will establish a solid foundation for any technology or programming language your student wishes to pursue next.

LEVEL: Beginner

Grades: 5th-12th

Welcome...before your first day of class, we have some HOMEWORK for you!

services.name: Python Workshop
services.description:
The Python Workshop is meant for all new students. This course will introduce you to our Python curriculum.

Students will learn the basics of Python, such as variables (integer, float, boolean, string), basic string I/O, conditional statements (if-elif-else), for loops, while loops, modulo, function calls, function definitions, and simple algorithms. For more information on our Python curriculum, click here.

*If you do not see a time that works for you, please fill out this FORM and a staff member will contact you.

services.name: Java Workshop
services.description:
The Java Workshop teaches new programmers the basics of programming with Java, starting with programs to draw simple graphics, then teaching about logic, functions, loops and variables, and ending with a small programming project.

For beginning programmers from 5th to 12th grade.

Students will learn:

  • Java commands and statements
  • Conditional Logic
  • Variables
  • Functions

services.name: Tech Discovery Camp (Robotics, Coding & AI) Full-Day
services.description:
Tech Discovery Camp is perfect for kids that want to try out a variety of tech areas. Each day is a new & exciting subject! Get ready for an exhilarating week of exploration and innovation at our Tech Discovery Camp designed for problem-solving and critical-thinking skills! This immersive camp offers a comprehensive introduction to various cutting-edge technologies, including coding, robotics, drones, and AI fundamentals.


Price: $950
Age: incoming 5th-12th grade
Skill Level: Beginner-Advanced
Format: On-Campus
Duration: Weeklong, 6 hours per day
Time: 9am-3pm
services.instructions:
Welcome...before your first day of class, we have some HOMEWORK for you!

  • Please have your student set up an account on GitHub. This is a TWO STEP PROCESS. First, on the GitHub site create a username and password which can be easily remembered by student. This account will be used to save class work on the first day (and each day thereafter). Second, after the account is created, GitHub will send you a verification email. You will need to open this email and follow the instructions for account verification. GitHub is a site which stores their code in the cloud so students can access it from home. It will enable students to build and organize their professional portfolio of work. Students will also be able to share their projects with you at home!

  • Email: info@jointheleague.org, and include your student’s name and their new GitHub username (you can send the password as well if you think they may forget it).

  • Upload a profile picture for your child. Their photo may be used both internally and on social media in announcements, such as when they level up. Please let us know if you do not want their photo to be used.

  1. Login to the parent portal

  2. On the right side menu under “People you manage” click on your child’s name.

  3. On their right side menu select “Photos”

  4. Click on “New Profile Photo” and upload your child’s photo


Below are a few important details to remember for the week of camp.

  • Camp drop-off begins at 8:30am. Classes begin promptly at 9am.

  • Lunch is from 12-1pm. Bring a snack and lunch from home daily.

Location: 12625 High Bluff Dr #113, San Diego, CA 92130

We are so excited to get started...can’t wait to see you!

services.name: Tech Club
services.description:
The LEAGUE Tech Club offers free technology classes to student from 4th to 12th grade in programming, robots and electronics. We run Tech Club classes at libraries and schools all over San Diego.

To enroll in Tech Club classes, get a Free Tech Club Membership and use it when you enroll in the class. See our page How to Enroll for more details.
services.description_short: This is the Summary

services.name: Robot Garage
services.description_short: Students build and program robots and other electronic projects using microcontrollers, motors and sensors. Students learn basic electronics, soldering, mechanical construction, communication busses, motion control and other aspects of software driven electronic devices. This class is most suitable for students 7th grade and older, and students should have some programming experience.
services.instructions: This meeting is in a residential garage workshop, at 1370 Wilbur in Pacific Beach.  Park on Gresham between Loring and Wilbur and enter the shop through the alley. The entrance is on the South side of the alley, one house west of Gresham.

services.name: Research Project
services.description_short: Summer research project. Student will learn how to setup, train and use neural networks in Python.

services.name: Holiday SLAMS - 3 Day
services.description:
Holiday Coding SLAM!

Accelerated Learning During Thanksgiving and Winter Break

What Is It?

A special 3-day intensive program for Java and Python students to advance their coding skills during the holiday season!

Perfect For:

  • Students currently in Levels 0-6
  • Those wanting to jump ahead in their learning
  • Students who'll miss regular classes due to holiday travel
  • Anyone wanting to keep their coding skills sharp over break

Program Features:

  • Guided learning environment
  • Expert teacher supervision
  • Personalized progress tracking
  • Flexible holiday scheduling

Details:

  • Price: $235 (includes all 3 sessions)
  • Format: In-person instruction
  • Prerequisite: Must be enrolled in regular weekly classes (Levels 0-6)

How to Join: Sign up Below!

Not yet a student? Contact us at info@jointheleague.org to enroll in regular classes first!

services.name: Python Workshop@SFC
services.description_short:
Python Programming Workshop at Santa Fe Christian

Date: Fridays, Jan 16, 23, 30; Feb 6, 13, 27; Mar 6, 13, 20
Time: 1:00 PM - 2:30 PM

Price: $350
Grades: 6-8; All levels welcome

Sign Up Below!

services.name: Intro to Micro:bit
services.description:
Learn the basics of programming in Python with this 5-day, 10-hour course suitable for students with no prior experience, from 5th to 12th grade. Our in-person classes have 5 or fewer students per instructor, ensuring individualized attention for every student. Python is one of the most popular programming languages and is used in fields such as science, engineering, web development, artificial intelligence, and many other applications, but it is also one of the easiest languages to learn. This course teaches students the basics of programming, including variables, lists, if/then logic, and loops—skills that can be further developed in advanced classes in either Python or Java. This course will establish a solid foundation for any technology or programming language your student wishes to pursue next.

LEVEL: Beginner

Grades: 5th-12th
services.instructions:
Welcome...before your first day of class, we have some HOMEWORK for you!

  • Please have your student set up an account on GitHub. This is a TWO STEP PROCESS. First, on the GitHub site create a username and password which can be easily remembered by student. This account will be used to save class work on the first day (and each day thereafter). Second, after the account is created, GitHub will send you a verification email. You will need to open this email and follow the instructions for account verification. GitHub is a site which stores their code in the cloud so students can access it from home. It will enable students to build and organize their professional portfolio of work. Students will also be able to share their projects with you at home!

  • Email: info@jointheleague.org, and include your student’s name and their new GitHub username (you can send the password as well if you think they may forget it).

  • Upload a profile picture for your child. Their photo may be used both internally and on social media in announcements, such as when they level up. Please let us know if you do not want their photo to be used.

  1. Login to the parent portal

  2. On the right side menu under “People you manage” click on your child’s name.

  3. On their right side menu select “Photos”

  4. Click on “New Profile Photo” and upload your child’s photo

We are so excited to get started...can’t wait to see you!

services.name: Summer Camps at St. James
services.description:
Code Camp:


Get ready to embark on an exciting journey into the world of Programming!

Students will Choose between Java and Python:

Whether you're a complete beginner or looking to sharpen your skills,this course is designed to take you from zero to hero in Python Programming. Dive into topics like data types, control structures,functions, and more - all while having fun and building practical projects. This course is perfect for beginner and intermediate programmers and is aligned with the Python Institute’s Professional Certificate Program. (Grades 4 and up)

Are you an aspiring computer scientist or really like making things with code, this course is perfect for you. You will have fun learning object oriented programming all while building practical projects. This course is perfect for intermediate and advanced programmers and is aligned with AP Comp Sci A Testing Standards. If you are new to coding we suggest our Python Apprentice Course. (Grades 5 and up)



Tech Discovery Camp:

Explore the world of Technology!

Are you curious about technology? Our Tech Discovery Camp includes introductions from our other camps in Python and Artificial Intelligence as well as an introduction to robotics with Micro:Bit. Explorers will jump into new technologies, opening up the world of computer science with days of coding, learning and playing with A.I. and how robotics work with mini computers. The Micro:Bit is a tiny computer which you can make robots with, you can program the microbit in multiple languages, including Python, Javascript, and Blocks.


AI Camp:

Unlock Your Child’s Potential with AI!

Discover the magic behind artificial intelligence in our hands-on, creative AI course. From building chatbots to generating images and exploring ethical AI, kids dive into machine learning, computer vision, and more—all guided by expert instructors. Turn curiosity into real-world skills today!



Please Note: These Camps are available to St. James Academy Students Only.

services.name: Intro to Robotics
services.description:
Build & Code: Micro:Bit Robotics

Take your coding skills to the next level by building and programming your own robot! In this exciting hands-on camp, students will use the Micro:Bit microcontroller to bring their creations to life. You'll learn how to program sensors, motors, and LEDs using Python, JavaScript, or block-based coding. Work with friends to design, build, and code robots that can move, interact, and respond to their environment. This camp is perfect for young engineers and programmers who want to explore the world of robotics in a fun and interactive way!

All equipment will be provided by The League of AMAZING Programmers. If you would like to keep your robot at the end of the course there will be an additional fee of $55.00 for the starter kit. As we progress through the course there may be optional add ons to the robot that can be purchased through amazon, those are optional and will be communicated if/when your child gets to that point.

services.name: Summer Code Arcade
services.description:
Summer Code Arcade

This summer, the choice is yours at Summer Code Arcade! Each day, campers can pick from exciting coding adventures like Game Hacking with Microsoft MakeCode, Intro to Code in Python and Java, or even work on their own special projects. Want to accelerate your skills in your current lessons plan? Come for focused learning sessions, just like our Slams!

With flexible scheduling, you can drop in for a single-day pass (use any day!) or go all-in with a full-week pass. Learn at your own pace, explore different topics, and have fun coding all summer long!

Sign up today and start your coding adventure!


Note: Summer camp sessions will be confirmed/scheduled once at least two students are registered for a given day. Registration must be completed at least two weeks in advance. If you have a late registration request, please email info@jointheleague.org.
services.description_short: Each day, campers can pick from exciting coding adventures like Game Hacking with Microsoft MakeCode, Intro to Code in Python and Java, or even work on their own special projects. Want to accelerate your skills in your current lessons plan? Come for focused learning sessions, just like our Slams!

services.name: Code Clinic
services.description_short: Free short introductions to software topics for advanced students.

services.name: League Labs
services.description_short:
LEAGUE Labs is our unpaid internship program for High School students to develop new LEAGUE classes. LEAGUE Labs Interns will create 90 minute classes, on a subject of their choice, and teach that class to other students in our Tech Club or Code Clinic programs. Interns will not only learn basic job skills, but can also explore a new topic, because the best way to really learn something is to try to teach it.

Interns in the program will gain important technical and soft skills with:

  • Tools like Github, Github Codespaces and Visual Studio Code
  • Programming
  • Product development and Human Centered Design
  • Marketing and Promotion ( you’ll need to beta test your class

services.name: Project Clinic Online
services.description_short: Expert consulting on student's programming projects.

services.name: Project Clinic Workshop
services.description: Build almost anything at the Robot Garage. We've got all of the parts, machines and equipment, and a expert builder to teach you what to do. We're equipped for electronics, robots and 3D printing and can help you build your project in wood, plastic or metal. Bring your project, or even just an idea, and we'll help you get it working.
services.description_short: Get expert help with your microcontroller, robotics or electronics project in the Robot Garage, a stocked shop with everthing you'll need for building your gadget.

services.name: Game Development with Godot
services.description:
Code Your Own Adventure: Game Making for Kids!

Course Overview

Ever wanted to create your own awesome video games? Now you can! Join us online as we dive into Godot, the coolest free game engine that works on any computer. You'll learn to code with GDScript (don't worry, it's super easy!) and discover how to bring your game ideas to life from the comfort of your own home. No coding experience needed—just bring your imagination!

What We'll Build Together!

Week 1: Meet Your New Superpower!

Explore Godot and get ready to become a game creator

Week 2: Make Characters Move and Jump!

Learn the magic behind getting your player to run, jump, and explore

Week 3: Add Bad Guys and Epic Battles!

Create enemies and give your hero cool weapons to fight back

Week 4: Crash, Boom, Level Up!

Make things collide and build multiple levels for epic adventures

Week 5: Make It Look Amazing!

Add awesome graphics, sounds, and menus that look professional

Week 6: Show Off Your Masterpiece!

Put the finishing touches on your game and share it with friends

You'll Become a Game Dev Wizard!

  • Turn your wildest game ideas into reality

  • Learn to code like a pro (but way more fun!)

  • Build characters that jump, run, and fight

  • Create entire worlds for players to explore

  • Design cool graphics and awesome sound effects

  • Have a finished game to show your friends and family

Zero experience required—just bring your creativity and get ready to have a blast!

services.name: AI Agents
services.description:
AI Agents: License to Code

Weekly Ongoing Class – Grades 5–12


 Build games, apps, and awesome projects with the help of AI!

In this fun, hands-on class, you’ll team up with AI coding agents to bring your ideas to life. You’ll create projects—like interactive games and web apps—while learning real coding skills along the way.

How it Works:

  • Start Anytime: Jump in at any point

  • Learn by Doing: Tell the AI what you want to build, guide it as it writes code, and learn how to make it your own.

  • Keep Leveling Up: Projects get more exciting and skills keep growing each week.

It’s like having a pro coder as your sidekick—so you can focus on creativity, problem-solving, and having fun while learning real-world coding skills.

  • Classes meet one day per week for 1.5 hours
  • Tuition is $280/month
Our weekly classes run every week throughout the year, so when you register, we will enroll you at the same class time every week (bulk enrollment). You can then cancel or reschedule individual classes online through the client portal.


To register for weekly classes
  • Review the schedule below for a day and time slot. ( It's best to select the "Month" view. )
  • Create a client account , and add your students to the account
  • Enroll in a first class for the day and time you want, from the list of classes below.
  • To enroll in all classes of the same day and time, every week, you can:
    • Email Liz Groves at info@jointheleague.org ( Click to compose an email ) with the day and time you would like.
    • Call us at (858) 284-0481.
    • Your child's instructor can enroll your child at the beginning of class.
For all details on enrollment, please see our Enrollment Guide and our Policies and Procedures.
services.description_short: Weekly AI class taught in person at our Carmel Valley classroom.
